father: King of the Myrmidons in Phthia
son: later a brutal warrior at Troy

items.name: Eros and Psyche
quests: Psyche (Soul): Represents the human soul's journey toward divine love
Eros (Love): Divine love that transforms and elevates
The Trials: The soul's purification through suffering and perseverance
Looking at Eros: The danger of curiosity and lack of faith
Apotheosis: The soul achieving immortality through love

items.name: Heracles
attributes: Alcides (birth name), Hercules (Roman), Lion of Nemea, Champion of Olympus, Defender of Mankind
Strength, heroism, labors, perseverance, athletic prowess, protection, courage
Lion skin, club, bow and arrows, olive wreath, golden apples
Great club (of olive wood), bow and hydra-poisoned arrows, sword
Golden tan (lion skin), olive green, crimson

items.name: Jason
items.description: Leader of the Argonauts and Seeker of the Golden Fleece

father: rightful king of Iolcus (killed or driven to suicide by Pelias)
uncle: usurper of Iolcus (killed by his own daughters through Medea's trickery)
sons: Mermeros and Pheres (or Thessalus and Alcimenes)
killed by Medea; twin sons by Hypsipyle of Lemnos
allies: various helpers encountered during the voyage
enemies: and ultimately Medea herself after his betrayal

wife: daughter of Icarius‚Äîrenowned for her fidelity and cleverness
son: who grew to manhood during Odysseus's absence and aided in slaying the suitors

items.name: Greek Mythology
attributes: Son of Apollo/Oeagrus and Calliope, Prophet of the Mysteries, Prince of Thrace, The Enchanter
Music, poetry, prophecy, mysteries, healing through song, eloquence
Lyre (seven-stringed), laurel wreath, tortoise (lyre's shell origin)
All creatures were subject to his music‚Äîlions, serpents, birds, even the beasts of the wild
Thrace, Lesbos (where his head washed ashore), various Orphic temples
All creatures were subject to his music‚Äîlions
even the beasts of the wild

father: in most traditions) or Oeagrus (King of Thrace)
aristaeus: Whose pursuit of Eurydice led to her death
dionysus: (in some versions) Who incited the Maenads against him

items.name: Perseus
attributes: Gorgon-Slayer, Founder of Mycenae, Son of the Golden Rain, Rescuer of Andromeda
Heroism, monster-slaying, divine favor, kingship, cunning
Medusa's head (Gorgoneion), winged sandals, helm of invisibility, kibisis (magic bag)
Harpe (curved adamantine sword from Hermes), polished bronze shield (from Athena)
Winged sandals (flight), Cap of Hades (invisibility), kibisis (safely contain Medusa's head)
Ancestor of Heracles, founder of the Perseid dynasty, constellation bearer

grandfather: King of Argos (accidentally killed by Perseus
athena: provided the polished shield and guided his sword-stroke
hermes: Gave the harpe and winged sandals
zeus: ensured his survival through divine providence
medusa: The mortal Gorgon whose death brought forth Pegasus
pegasus: The winged horse born from Medusa's blood (later tamed by Bellerophon)
dictys: The humble fisherman who became his foster-father

mother: daughter of King Pittheus of Troezen
enemies: Medea (stepmother who tried to poison him)

items.name: Krishna
items.description: Eighth avatar of Vishnu, teacher of the Bhagavad Gita, and one of Hinduism's most beloved deities. See also Krishna as Deity.

items.name: Buddhist Mythology
items.description: The spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhism, believed to be the reincarnation of Avalokiteshvara, the Bodhisattva of Compassion. The current (14th) Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso, is a Nobel Peace Prize laureate and global spiritual leader.

items.name: Buddhist Mythology
items.description: Tibetan king (7th century CE) who introduced Buddhism to Tibet. Considered an emanation of Avalokiteshvara. Built the first Buddhist temples in Tibet including the Jokhang.

items.name: Founder of Madhyamaka
items.description: The Second Buddha, Founder of Madhyamaka Philosophy

items.name: Buddhist Mythology
items.description: 8th century Indian Buddhist monk and scholar, author of the Bodhicharyavatara (Guide to the Bodhisattva's Way of Life), one of the most important texts on compassion and the bodhisattva path.

items.name: Buddhist Mythology
items.description: Great Tibetan Buddhist teacher (1357-1419) and founder of the Gelug school of Tibetan Buddhism. Considered an emanation of Manjushri, the Bodhisattva of Wisdom.

items.name: The First Called
items.description: Brother of Peter, first disciple to follow Jesus, evangelist who brought others to Christ. Martyred on an X-shaped cross that bears his name.

items.name: Son of Thunder
items.displayName: ‚öîÔ∏è James the Greater - Son of Thunder
items.description: Son of Zebedee, brother of John, member of Christ's inner circle. The first apostle martyred, beheaded by Herod Agrippa in 44 CE.

items.name: The Beloved Disciple
items.description: The disciple whom Jesus loved, who leaned on His breast at the Last Supper. Gospel author, theologian, seer of Revelation. The only apostle not martyred, lived to old age in Ephesus.

items.name: The Rock
items.description: First among the apostles, leader of the early Church, first Pope. The fisherman who denied Christ three times yet became the fearless rock of faith, martyred upside down in Rome.

items.name: Prophet
attributes: Father of Prophets, Patriarch of monotheism

items.name: Prophet
attributes: Parting the Red Sea, Receiving the Torah

items.name: Avraham Avinu | Jewish Heroes
items.description:
Abraham (Hebrew: Avraham) is the founding patriarch of the Jewish people, the first Hebrew, and the father of
monotheism. Born Abram in Ur of the Chaldees, he received God's call to leave his homeland and journey to Canaan, where
God established an eternal covenant with him and his descendants. He is revered as "Avraham Avinu" (Abraham our Father),
the first to recognize the One True God and the ancestor of the Israelite nation.

items.name: Eyes of Azrael
items.displayName: 1 Enoch: Heavenly Journeys and Cosmic Secrets
titles: Passes knowledge to Methuselah and descendants
Writes their petition but it is rejected
"Behold, he comes with ten thousands of holy ones"
Uriel reveals paths of heavenly bodies

items.displayName: Enoch as Idris in Islamic Tradition

items.description: Moses and Aaron vs. Pharaoh's Sorcerers: Divine Power vs. Egyptian Magic

items.name: Moshe Rabbeinu | Jewish Heroes
items.description:
Moses (Moshe in Hebrew) is the greatest prophet in Jewish tradition, the lawgiver who received the Torah at
Mount Sinai and led the Israelites from slavery in Egypt to freedom. He is revered as "Moshe Rabbeinu" (Moses our
Teacher), the mediator between God and Israel, and the founder of the Jewish nation and religion.
